Downvoted only due to the following:

The practice of paying for mods is antithetical to the nature of the modding community; an optional "DONATION" button is not (Just like on the Nexus http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/? ). Was a fun game, The fact that Valve is doing this and that Bethesda is endorsing it and they both taking the largest share of the modders' work is American Corporate greed at it's finest.

Take something artistic and done for the love of the subject matter, monetize it, then allow the accountants to define art as widgets, and then creativity is now run by the mercantile class, the middle men, who are "America Corporates".

If they had any integrity and decency, any moneys brought in, at the very least, should be 100% donated to charities on behalf off the modding community in conjunction with Valve or Bethesda or whomever. See Gaben, you don't need the cash grab, you can win by getting good press which in the long run would do better for you to show you are not like EA et al.

A simple point and shoot First Person Shooter & Zombies kind of game but damn do they know how to do it so well!

 You'll play one of four distinct characters in their fight for survival. But you've heard this but a thousand times, innocent people trapped and must take arms to defend themselves. Left 4 Dead breaks past the cliché of those innocent people and sticks you up against a highly entertaining array of enemies with a equally highly entertaining amount of weapons that make you feel as if you're bringing zombie justice down on their tiny little skulls. If you like FPS games and don't mind possibly getting a tad freaked out by zombies or the horrific nature then this game is for you!
They Left U 4 Dead ... Do U think U can survive these dangers?
puta merda jogo foda pra caralho 4 pessoas contra 1 milhao de zombies e mutantes!!!!!!!! :D!!!!!! '-' !!!!!!!!!!! :( !!!!!!!! :)

É só provavelmente o melhor jogo cooperativo alguma vez criado.

Se gostas do género FPS e sempre tiveste aquela panca por zombies, cenários apocalípticos e se alguma vez te imaginaste num mundo destes, muito possívelmente junto com um grupo de amigos à procura de mantimentos e a sobreviver um dia de cada vez, então esta é a tua, ou melhor, a vossa oportunidade de se colocarem à prova.

Inicialmente com apenas quatro campanhas, o jogo conta também com oito modos de jogo diferentes. Os criadores decidiram mais tarde adicionar mais duas campanhas à lista para complementar a história, isto sem contar com as centenas de campanhas e mapas únicos fan-made disponíveis para download e ao dispor da comunidade, que acrescentam infinitas horas de vício.

Não consigo imaginar melhores personagens que as que foram introduzidas no jogo. Bill, o típico velho veterano de barba branca com toda a sua experiência de vida, Louis, o empresário citadino hilariante que nos desmancha a rir do início ao fim do jogo com as suas falas, Zoey, a sexy ex-estudante em cinema, e Francis, o famoso motard tatuado parvalhão e ao mesmo tempo engraçado. A equipa está completa.

Left 4 Dead é um jogo que vos vai deixar completamente agarrados e a chorar por mais. Os momentos hilariantes passados com os amigos não conhecem limites.

Resumindo... Um título obrigatório em qualquer biblioteca de jogos!
This is where it all begins.
this bascily was the test or beta of l4d2 the story is the best of the 2 but the game modes, weapons, characters and zombies are basic.

I avoided this game for a solid year or so thinking it wasn't something I'd like, but after trying the demo of Left 4 Dead 2 I was hooked, and quickly became a fairly dedicated fan of both games. I have more hours logged in L4D2, but I actually have come to prefer the first given its darker, grim atmosphere and top notch level design. L4D2 is not the opposite in mood or quality, not by a long shot, but the urban and rural environments here strike a pitch perfect chord of dread and bloodthirsty threat.

It's got that magic Valve touch. Intense but at the same time hilarious and fun. Best shared with close friends.

Focuses more to the action than the story line but still amasingly fun and exciting.

Fun game! Even though the AI players are total blithering idiots.But there is something satisfying to mowing down hordes of zombies.

Left 4 Dead is an amazing game. I am a lover of all things Valve, and a sucker for games that make you feel epic in every aspect possible, and this game delievered exactly these things. My interest in buying this game came from the Steam Halloween sales...I knew not much about it except for a pretty cool trailer I saw for it, and was also considering Killing Floor. I got both, and gotta say I love L4D over twice as much. I've never really played a multiplayer co-op before but this just took me by the balls and made them produce a cournucopia of jizz due to the amazing factor. It brings together players easily and in very cool ways. CONSIDERING L4D2 OVER THIS?? Grab this one. The characters are so much more fun imo, and I think the hype of new weapons is unnecessary, as I have never felt a shortage or care of weapon diversity. And melee weapons are cool but more of an extra, and will kill you if you buy a game for that! Also L4D is very populated!! 

(My first impressions in comments)

A Classic game for playing online with your buddies and shooting zombies all the time, a very good cooperation and survival game in my opinion

There's always merit to playing the first game before you play the second. In my case, I had it backwards. Ooops. Oh well. Anyway, yes Left 4 dead is great. Especially if you love mostly-mindlessly blowing zombies to hell and back. The one thing I don't like? The lack of guns. My two favorites aren't on Left 4 Dead. Sad. Unfortunately, or maybe fortunately, I haven't played with many non-friends so I can't actually say the people are less douchey and are less likely to run off with you when you're searching the houses/buildings for things. (cough) Anyway. Worthwhile, especially on sale.

Does this epic multiplayer monster need an introduction?  Nothing I can say will do it justice - but I'll try.

The original.  The masterpiece.  Left 4 Dead 2 is a great improvement on many aspects, to be sure, but you just can't beat the old days... when all we had was an M-16 and a Jesus-room to ward off the literal hordes of undead.  Now that L4D2 is out and all of the L4D1 maps are available in it - as well as game modes that remove all of L4D2's new items and infected - there really isn't a reason to pick up the first... but it will always have a place in my heart.

The base concept of moving from area to area killing hordes of zombies is nothing new. How they go about making it is remarkable, however. The game forces teamwork and with the help of the ai director you can play this game over and over and over and almost never have two similar situations and the VS is pertty cool to up to 8 players 1 team as the zombies 1 team as the survivors but this game isnt that fun playing solo or with someone you dont know so get this if you have some friends to kill zombies with ya ^^
